sentences.english: They tied him up to a pole and burned him alive in 1415.
sentences.chinese: 1415年胡斯被绑在柱子上活活烧死。

sentences.english: They poison other fish and digest them while the fish are alive.
sentences.chinese: 它们对其他鱼放毒，然后将这些鱼活活消化。

sentences.english: The poor man at last was eased and hence lived happily.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的人终于安下心来，快快活活地过日子了。

sentences.english: It wasn't near as bad as, say, being eaten alive by wolves.
sentences.chinese: 说起来，它也还并没有糟糕到被群狼活活吞噬的地步。

sentences.english: After all, these tiny fishes are lives too, why should they be tortured to death?
sentences.chinese: 小鱼毕竟是条生命，干嘛要活活地憋死它啊？

sentences.english: Who would have thought Xu hands energetically will actually strangled his mother alive.
sentences.chinese: 谁知，徐某竟手上使劲将母亲活活勒死了。

sentences.english: Many people were burnt alive in the conflagration that happened in a multi-storeyed building.
sentences.chinese: 在一幢多层大厦内发生的大火中，很多人被活活烧死。

sentences.english: But cannot be hit, tango results were spirit alive pushed his o tang.
sentences.chinese: 可阿唐不能打，结果被气得活活推了阿唐一跤。

sentences.english: The light that plays, like a naked child.
sentences.chinese: 光明如一个裸体的孩子，快快活活地在绿叶当中游戏。

sentences.english: There'll be an explosion, and we'll be burned alive.
sentences.chinese: 会发生爆炸，而我们会被活活烧死。

sentences.english: THE RECHECKS WERE eating Nick alive.
sentences.chinese: 接二连三的返修简直活活要了尼克的命。

sentences.english: He was so angry he nearly flayed his horse alive.
sentences.chinese: 他气得几乎把马活活抽死。

sentences.english: The next day, and were tied to a post by the Japanese, burned alive.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，牛二被日本人绑在柱子上，活活烧死。

sentences.english: 12The people took the young man home alive and were greatly comforted.
sentences.chinese: 有人把那童子活活的领来，得的安慰不小。

sentences.english: Today, her mother burned to eat my favorite braised fish.
sentences.chinese: 今天，她的母亲活活吃我最喜欢的红烧鱼。

sentences.english: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.
sentences.chinese: 有人把那童子活活的领来，得的安慰不小。

definition: to starve to death/to be very hungry
to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to freeze to death/to die off in winter
